maml:description.maml:para: Searches for specified SysMon Events and retunrs the Event Data as a custom object.
Searches for specified SysMon Events and retunrs the Event Data as a custom object.

maml:Description.maml:para: Sysmon Event ID of records to show
Specifies the maximum number of events that Get-WinEvent returns. Enter an integer. The default is to return all the events in the logs or files.
Specifies a path to one or more exported SysMon events in evtx format.
Start Date to get all event going forward.
EventType that a Rule can be written against.
Specifies the maximum number of events that Get-WinEvent returns. Enter an integer. The default is to return all the events in the logs or files.
Specifies a path to one or more exported SysMon events in evtx format.
Start Date to get all event going forward.
Sysmon Event ID of records to show
EventType that a Rule can be written against.
Specifies the maximum number of events that Get-WinEvent returns. Enter an integer. The default is to return all the events in the logs or files.
Specifies a path to one or more exported SysMon events in evtx format.
Start Date to get all event going forward.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-SysMonEventData -EventId 1 -MaxEvents 10 -EndTime (Get-Date) -StartTime (Get-Date).AddDays(-1)

dev:remarks.maml:para: All process creation events in the last 24hr

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-SysMonEventData -EventId 3 -MaxEvents 20 -Path .\export.evtx

dev:remarks.maml:para: last 20 network connection events from a exported SysMon log.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Get the configured filters for a specified Event Type Rule in a Sysmon configuration file.
Get the configured filters for a specified Event Type Rule in a Sysmon configuration file.

maml:Description.maml:para: Event type rule to get filter for.
Event type rule to get filter for.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-SysmonRuleFilter -Path C:\sysmon.xml -EventType ProcessCreate

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the filter under the ProcessCreate Rule.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new filter for the logging file creation.
Create a new filter for the logging file creation.

maml:Description.maml:para: Condition for filtering against and event field.
Value of Event Field to filter on.
Condition for filtering against and event field.
Value of Event Field to filter on.
Condition for filtering against and event field.
Value of Event Field to filter on.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new filter for the logging of the saving of data on a file stream.
Create a new filter for the logging of the saving of data on a file stream.

maml:Description.maml:para: Condition for filtering against and event field.
Value of Event Field to filter on.
Condition for filtering against and event field.
Value of Event Field to filter on.
Condition for filtering against and event field.
Value of Event Field to filter on.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-SysmonRegistryEvent -Path .\32config.xml -OnMatch include -Condition Contains -EventField TargetObject 'RunOnce'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Capture persistance attemp by creating a registry entry in the RunOnce keys.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new filter for when a Named Pipe is created or connected.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new filter for the logging of when a running process opens another.
Create a new filter for the logging of when a running process opens another.

maml:Description.maml:para: Condition for filtering against and event field.
Value of Event Field to filter on.
Condition for filtering against and event field.
Value of Event Field to filter on.
Condition for filtering against and event field.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-SysmonProcessAccessFilter -Path .\testver31.xml -OnMatch include -Condition Contains -EventField TargetImage lsass.exe

dev:remarks.maml:para: Log any process trying to open lsass.exe.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new filter for the actions against the registry.
Create a new filter for actions against the registry. Supports filtering by aby of the following event types: * CreateKey
Hives in TargetObject are referenced as: * \REGISTRY\MACHINE\HARDWARE

maml:Description.maml:para: Condition for filtering against and event field.
Value of Event Field to filter on.
Condition for filtering against and event field.
Value of Event Field to filter on.
Condition for filtering against and event field.
Value of Event Field to filter on.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new filter for the actions against the registry.
Create a new filter for actions against the registry. Supports filtering by aby of the following event types: * CreateKey
Hives on Schema 3.2 in TargetObject are referenced as: * \REGISTRY\MACHINE\HARDWARE
Hives on Schema 3.3 and above in TargetObject are referenced as: * HKLM

maml:Description.maml:para: Condition for filtering against and event field.
Value of Event Field to filter on.

Value of Event Field to filter on.
Condition for filtering against and event field.
Value of Event Field to filter on.

command:example.dev:code: New-SysmonRegistryFilter -Path .\32config.xml -OnMatch include -Condition Contains -EventField TargetObject 'RunOnce'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Capture persistance attemp by creating a registry entry in the RunOnce keys.
